The unofficial name '''Christopher Tolkien Centenary Boxed Sets''' refers to a series of hardcover books published by [[HarperCollins]] from [[2023]] to [[2025]]. The publication of the series coincides with the centenary celebration of [[Christopher Tolkien]] (1924-2020), the literary executor of his father [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]. All books included in this series were edited by Christopher. The series includes 6 boxed sets, each containing 3-4 volumes. The volumes are bound in hardcover, featuring double-sided dustjackets, which can be removed and put back in reverse. Set #1 - #4 are the "[[legendarium]]" books, including ''[[The Silmarillion]]'', ''[[Unfinished Tales]]'', and 12 ''[[The History of Middle-earth]]'' volumes. Their dustjackets reproduce on one side the original covers of the first hardcover editions, on the other side the illustrated covers of the first paperback editions, by [[John Howe]]. Set #5 is a "Myths and Legends" set, including ''[[Sir Gawain and the Green Knight, Pearl, and Sir Orfeo]]'', ''[[The Legend of Sigurd and Gudrún]]'', ''[[The Fall of Arthur]]'', and ''[[Beowulf: A Translation and Commentary]]''. Set #6 is a reissue of the three "Great Tales of Middle-earth" books, but published as a single box for the first time in UK by HarperCollins. These do not have the reversible dustjackets. A second "Myths and Legends" box, containing 5 books by J.R.R. Tolkien, is planned to release in May 2026. It most notably includes the first ever reprint of ''[[The Old English Exodus]]'' since its 1982 publication. ==Gallery== File:Christopher Tolkien Centenary Set 1.png|Box #1
